intro: Meibomia diversifolia, commonly known as the variable-leaved meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that vary in shape and size, giving it its common name. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four to five petals. Meibomia diversifolia is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
